sa1.6:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove of Śrāvastī.
sa1.6:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa1.6:2.2: “When you don’t know and don’t understand form and don’t stop and become free of desire for it, you aren’t able to stop suffering.
sa1.6:2.3: Thus, when you don’t know and don’t understand feeling …
sa1.6:2.6: consciousness and don’t stop and become free of desire for it, you aren’t able to stop suffering.
sa1.6:3.1: “Monks, if you know and understand form and stop and become free of desire for it, you’ll be able to end suffering.
sa1.6:3.2: Thus, if you know and understand feeling …
sa1.6:3.5: consciousness and end and become free of desire for it, you’ll be able to end suffering.”
sa1.6:4.1: The monks who heard what the Buddha taught then rejoiced and approved.
